Comment: Means 'three thrice...' or 'three times ...(that occurs)'. Cf. 13.380.
Respectively: lit. 'one-masc. dimin.'; 'one-fem. dimin.' From Span. 'uno'.

Respectively: '3pp-plant/put/place-masc. thing'; '3pp-plant-fem. thing'. Masc., referring to cotton, and fem., referring to squash.
Respectively: '3pp-plant/put/place-masc. thing'; '3pp-plant-fem. thing'. Masc., referring to cotton, and fem., referring to squash.

Lit. '3pp-rake/sweep-intrans.-fem. thing'; also used for 'broom'. Also yi-polek ha-nʔ ʔipaḳ l-awe, '3pa-rake/ sweep fem.-thing present tree 3pp-leaves'.
Refers to fence made of posts and/or wire.
Respectively: lit. '3pp-cut with hoe (trans.)'; '3pp-cut with hoe-intrans.'.
Respectively: lit. '3pp-cut with hoe (trans.)'; '3pp-cut with hoe-intrans.'.
Lit. '3pp-drink-enclosure (his own drinking vessel). Also li-'yom-aʁan-ataʁan-aʁaki; '3pp-drink-causative-intrans.-enclosure (his vessel for causing others to drink)'.
Respectively: lit. 'house-3pp-side'; '3pp-protect (trans.)-masc. thing (one's own protective wall)'.
Respectively: lit. 'house-3pp-side'; '3pp-protect (trans.)-masc. thing (one's own protective wall)'.
Respectively: '3pp-cut (< -petek)-intrans.-masc. thing (his instrument for cutting others' hair); 3pp-cut-masc. thing (his own hair's cutter)'.

Lit. 'pelak (kind of tree)-3pp-fruit'; means 'fruit of the pelak tree'.
Lit. '3pp-hair-masc. thing' 04.140. Also possible, yolelaʁaik, 'has much hair'.
Refers to tongs which are used to harvest prickly cactus fruit.
A large bowl, used to prepare 'algarroba'.

Refers to fleshy underchin. Cf. 'necklace' 06.750. Adam's Apple is lo-ḳoičiyi.
Used for both sexes; also means other relative, cousin 02.550.

Lit. '3pp-teach-enclosure (place where he is taught)'. Also l-apaʁagen-ataʁan-aʁaki, 3pp-teach-intrans.-enclosure (place where he teaches others)'.
